headline: Will Ralph Lauren’s (RL) London Polo Bar Push Experience-Driven Growth or Stretch Its Brand Strategy?
summary: Ralph Lauren Corporation recently announced the upcoming launch of The Polo Bar Ralph Lauren in London, set to open in 2028 at 1 Hanover Square, further expanding its hospitality portfolio beyond its celebrated New York location. This move builds on over 40 years of Ralph Lauren's brand presence in the United Kingdom and highlights its growing focus on experience-driven brand extensions in key global cities. We'll examine how the planned London restaurant opening underscores Ralph Lauren's...

headline: Ralph Lauren Shares Tangible Progress and Changing Targets in 2025 GC&S Report
summary: Ralph Lauren will retire its 2040 net-zero goal in favor of setting rolling five-year GHG reduction milestones, the brand shared in its annual report.

content.title: Ralph Lauren Shares Tangible Progress and Changing Targets in 2025 GC&S Report
content.summary: Ralph Lauren will retire its 2040 net-zero goal in favor of setting rolling five-year GHG reduction milestones, the brand shared in its annual report.

headline: Ralph Lauren Releases 2025 Global Citizenship & Sustainability Report
summary: NEW YORK, October 02, 2025--Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) today released its 2025 Global Citizenship & Sustainability Report, highlighting the Company's meaningful progress on the commitments laid out within its Timeless by Design strategy. Grounded in Ralph Lauren’s Purpose, to inspire the dream of a better life through authenticity and timeless style, and a key enabler to its Next Great Chapter: Drive strategy announced in September, Timeless by Design captures Ralph Lauren’s work to supp

headline: Inside Ralph Lauren’s Big Comeback — And How it Won Over Gen Z
summary: Facing brand dilution and declining wholesale sales in the 2010s, Ralph Lauren has sought to reinvent itself and win over a younger generation. Under CEO Patrice Louvet, the company pulled back from heavy discounting, doubled down on its own stores and digital platforms, and refocused on core values like authenticity and timeless design. Today Ralph Lauren is seeing renewed growth, topping $7 billion in revenue the first time in nearly a decade. Fortune's Phil Wahba sat down with Louvet to learn about the strategy behind the turnaround.

Fortune's Phil Wahba sat down with Louvet to learn about the strategy behind the turnaround.
